activities.name: General Highlights Exploration
activities.description: Wander through the vast collection at your own pace, ensuring you see iconic artifacts like the Rosetta Stone, the Parthenon Marbles, and the Egyptian mummies.

activities.name: Expert-Led 'Around the World in 90 Minutes' Tour
activities.description: Join an official museum guide for a fast-paced tour of the museum's most famous and significant artifacts from across the globe.

activities.name: Family Fun: Museum Mission
activities.description: Pick up a free family trail from the information desk and turn your visit into an exciting treasure hunt through history.

activities.name: Full Tower Exploration & Crown Jewels
activities.description: Explore the entire historic fortress, see the magnificent Crown Jewels, walk the ancient walls, and visit the White Tower.

activities.name: Yeoman Warder 'Beefeater' Tour
activities.description: Be entertained by the captivating and often gruesome tales of the Tower's history on this highly engaging guided tour. Included with admission.

activities.name: Ceremony of the Keys
activities.description: Witness the ancient nightly gate-locking ritual. This is a ticketed event that must be booked months in advance.

activities.name: Standard London Eye Rotation
activities.description: Take a 30-minute rotation in one of the iconic glass pods for stunning 360-degree views of London. Total experience time is longer.

activities.name: London Eye: Fast Track
activities.description: Beat the queues with a pre-booked fast track ticket, giving you more time to enjoy the rest of the city.

activities.name: Witness the Changing of the Guard
activities.description: Experience the world-famous display of British pageantry outside the palace gates. Arrive at least 30-45 minutes early for a good view. (Exterior only)

activities.name: Summer Opening: State Rooms Tour
activities.description: Gain rare access to the lavishly furnished State Rooms used by The King for official events. (Available for a limited period in summer)

activities.name: Palace Exterior Photo Opportunity
activities.description: Take iconic photos in front of the famous palace gates and the Victoria Memorial.

activities.name: Leisurely Park Stroll & Picnic
activities.description: Enjoy a walk or picnic, visit the Serpentine Lake and Princess Diana Memorial Fountain, and relax in this vast green oasis.

activities.name: Boating on the Serpentine Lake
activities.description: Rent a paddle boat or rowing boat for a fun and relaxing time on the famous lake. (Seasonal)

activities.name: Visit Speaker's Corner
activities.description: Witness the home of free speech, where people from all walks of life share their views on a Sunday morning.

activities.name: Westminster Abbey Entry with Audio Guide
activities.description: Explore this stunning Gothic church, the site of royal coronations, weddings, and the resting place of many historical figures.

activities.name: Attend Evensong Service
activities.description: Experience the Abbey's magnificent acoustics by attending a beautiful, traditional choral Evensong service. (Donations welcome)

activities.name: Photo Stop at Big Ben & Parliament
activities.description: Admire and photograph the iconic exterior of the Houses of Parliament and the Elizabeth Tower (Big Ben) from Parliament Square or across the river.

activities.name: Guided Tour of the Houses of Parliament
activities.description: Discover the heart of UK politics with a tour through the House of Commons, House of Lords, and historic Westminster Hall. (Booking essential)

activities.name: Explore Tate Modern's Free Collection
activities.description: Discover international modern and contemporary art, from Picasso to Warhol, in the spectacular Turbine Hall and gallery spaces.

activities.name: View from the Blavatnik Building
activities.description: Take the lift to the viewing level of the Blavatnik Building for a fantastic free panoramic view of the London skyline.

activities.name: Cathedral Entry, Dome Climb & Crypt
activities.description: Explore Wren's masterpiece, whisper in the Whispering Gallery, climb to the Golden Gallery for spectacular views, and visit the crypt.

activities.name: Experience a Choral Service
activities.description: Listen to the world-renowned choir during a service for a truly moving and atmospheric experience. (Donations welcome)

activities.name: Dinosaur & Earth Hall Encounter
activities.description: Marvel at the giant dinosaur skeletons, feel the earth shake in the earthquake simulator, and explore the vast collection of natural wonders.

activities.name: Visit a Ticketed Exhibition
activities.description: Explore one of the museum's world-class temporary exhibitions, often focusing on wildlife photography or specific scientific topics.

activities.name: V&A General Visit
activities.description: Explore the world's leading museum of art and design, with treasures from fashion and jewellery to furniture and sculpture.

activities.name: Focus on Fashion and Jewellery
activities.description: Dedicate your time to the V&A's world-renowned fashion collection and the stunning William and Judith Bollinger Jewellery Gallery.

activities.name: General Science Exploration
activities.description: Discover world-changing inventions, from Stephenson's Rocket to the Apollo 10 command module, across multiple floors of exhibits.

activities.name: Wonderlab: The Equinor Gallery
activities.description: Get hands-on with real scientific phenomena through interactive exhibits, shows, and demonstrations. (Ticketed)

activities.name: Masterpieces of Western Art
activities.description: See world-famous works by Van Gogh (Sunflowers), da Vinci, Botticelli, Turner, and many others in this world-class art gallery.

activities.name: Free 'Art in the Making' Tour
activities.description: Join a free daily talk to learn more about the techniques and stories behind some of the collection's greatest paintings.

activities.name: Tower Bridge Exhibition
activities.description: Walk across the high-level glass walkway, see the Victorian Engine Rooms, and learn about the bridge's history and engineering.

activities.name: Watch a Bridge Lift
activities.description: Check the lift times online and watch the iconic bascules raise to allow a tall ship to pass through. A fantastic free spectacle.

activities.name: Watch a Play as a 'Groundling'
activities.description: Experience a play as an Elizabethan would have, standing in the open-air yard for an authentic and immersive theatrical experience.

activities.name: Shakespeare's Globe Theatre Tour
activities.description: Take an expertly guided tour of this faithful reconstruction of Shakespeare's iconic 'wooden O' theatre. (Separate from play tickets)

activities.name: The View from The Shard
activities.description: Ascend to the top of Western Europe's tallest building for breathtaking 360-degree views from the indoor and open-air viewing platforms.

activities.name: Cocktails at Aqua Shard
activities.description: Enjoy a sophisticated cocktail with stunning views from the atrium bar on level 31. (Cost is for one cocktail)

activities.name: Gourmet Street Food Lunch
activities.description: Explore the vibrant stalls and choose from a huge variety of delicious street food options for lunch.

activities.name: Artisan Produce Shopping
activities.description: Browse and buy from a huge range of high-quality produce, including artisan cheeses, cured meats, fresh bread, and olives.

activities.name: Watch Street Performers in the Piazza
activities.description: Find a spot on the steps and enjoy the free, high-quality street entertainment, from opera singers to magicians.

activities.name: Explore the Apple Market
activities.description: Browse the stalls in the covered market for unique handmade crafts, jewellery, and antiques. (Cost is an estimate for a small purchase)

activities.name: Kensington Palace Admission
activities.description: Explore the birthplace of Queen Victoria and home to young royals for centuries. See the King's and Queen's State Apartments.

activities.name: Walk through the Palace Gardens
activities.description: Enjoy a stroll through the beautiful and serene formal gardens adjacent to the palace, a peaceful escape from the city.

activities.name: Stroll Queen Mary's Gardens
activities.description: Visit one of London's most beautiful formal gardens, especially in early summer when the 12,000 roses are in bloom.

activities.name: Pedalo Boating on Regent's Park Lake
activities.description: Hire a pedalo and enjoy a fun trip around the picturesque boating lake. (Seasonal)

activities.name: Visit the Open Air Theatre
activities.description: Catch a play or musical in a magical setting during the summer season. A unique London experience.

activities.name: Explore Camden Market
activities.description: Get lost in the labyrinth of stalls selling alternative fashion, unique gifts, and crafts. (Cost is estimate for purchase)

activities.name: Global Street Food Feast
activities.description: Sample delicious food from around the world from the extensive street food section by the canal.

activities.name: Walk to the General Wolfe Statue Viewpoint
activities.description: Hike to the top of the hill for one of London's most iconic and protected views, overlooking the Queen's House and the skyscrapers of Canary Wharf.

activities.name: Relax by the Flower Garden and Pond
activities.description: Find the tranquil enclosed garden area for a peaceful rest among beautiful flowerbeds and a duck pond.

activities.name: Stand on the Prime Meridian Line
activities.description: Visit the home of Greenwich Mean Time (GMT), straddle the Prime Meridian with one foot in each hemisphere, and explore the historic observatory.

activities.name: Attend a Planetarium Show
activities.description: Journey through space in a stunning show at the Peter Harrison Planetarium. (Can be booked with or without observatory entry)

activities.name: Explore the Cutty Sark
activities.description: Climb aboard the world's sole surviving tea clipper, walk beneath its gleaming copper hull, and discover life at sea.

activities.name: Trafalgar Square Photo Stop
activities.description: Visit the famous square, take photos with Nelson's Column and the iconic lion statues, and see the fountains.

activities.name: See the Fourth Plinth Artwork
activities.description: Check out the latest contemporary art installation on the famous 'Fourth Plinth' in the north-west corner of the square.

activities.name: Experience the Piccadilly Lights
activities.description: Soak in the atmosphere of London's 'Times Square', with its huge video displays and the statue of Eros. Best experienced at dusk.

activities.name: Churchill War Rooms & Museum Tour
activities.description: Explore the secret underground headquarters where Churchill directed WWII and learn about his life in the interactive museum.

activities.name: Hampton Court Palace, Gardens & Maze
activities.description: Discover the magnificent Tudor palace of Henry VIII, explore the stunning gardens, and get lost in the world-famous maze.

activities.name: Full Day at Kew Gardens
activities.description: Spend a day exploring the vast botanical gardens, iconic Victorian glasshouses (the Palm House and Temperate House), and treetop walkway.

activities.name: Visit The Hive and Great Pagoda
activities.description: Focus your visit on the multi-sensory Hive installation and climb the newly restored Great Pagoda for fantastic views. (Included in entry)

activities.name: ZSL London Zoo Adventure
activities.description: Spend a day discovering thousands of animals at the world's oldest scientific zoo, seeing exhibits like Land of the Lions and Gorilla Kingdom.

activities.name: Explore The National Portrait Gallery
activities.description: Discover portraits of famous and influential Britons from the Tudors to today, following a major refurbishment.

activities.name: Imperial War Museum London Visit
activities.description: Explore powerful exhibits on modern conflict, from the immersive WWI galleries to the thought-provoking Holocaust exhibition.

activities.name: Discover The Wallace Collection
activities.description: Step into a historic London townhouse and discover a treasure trove of fine art, furniture, and armour, including Hals' 'The Laughing Cavalier'.

activities.name: Explore Sir John Soane's Museum
activities.description: Explore the eccentric and atmospheric house-museum, packed with art, antiquities, and curiosities. A truly unique experience.

activities.name: Luxury Window Shopping
activities.description: Experience the opulence and stunning window displays of one of the world's most famous department stores.

activities.name: Explore the Food Halls
activities.description: Marvel at the spectacular displays in the ornate Food Halls and perhaps buy a luxury treat. (Cost is an estimate for purchase)

activities.name: The Globe Theatre Tour & Exhibition
activities.description: An expertly guided tour exploring the story of the iconic Globe Theatre and the London of Shakespeare's time.

activities.name: Explore Tate Britain
activities.description: Walk through the home of British art from 1500 to the present day, with dedicated galleries for artists like J.M.W. Turner.

activities.name: Southbank Centre Book Market
activities.description: Browse for second-hand books at the bustling market under Waterloo Bridge, open daily.

activities.name: Attend a Free Foyer Performance
activities.description: Check the schedule for free music, workshops, and performances in the foyer of the Royal Festival Hall.

activities.name: SEA LIFE London Aquarium Visit
activities.description: Discover a huge collection of global marine life, walk through the shark tunnel, and see penguins and jellyfish.

activities.name: The London Dungeon Experience
activities.description: A thrilling and scary attraction that walks you through London's darkest history with live actors and rides. (Not for the faint-hearted)

activities.name: Meet the Stars at Madame Tussauds
activities.description: Pose with wax figures of your favourite celebrities, historical icons, royalty, and superheroes.

activities.name: Feed the Pelicans
activities.description: Stroll through this beautiful park and see the famous pelicans being fed daily between 2:30 PM and 3:00 PM.

activities.name: View of Buckingham Palace from the Blue Bridge
activities.description: Walk to the middle of the Blue Bridge over the lake for a classic, picture-perfect view of Buckingham Palace.

activities.name: Climb The Monument
activities.description: Climb the 311 spiral steps to the top of Sir Christopher Wren's column for panoramic views and receive a certificate upon completion.

activities.name: Walk and Photograph Colourful Houses
activities.description: Wander the charming streets and mews of Notting Hill to see and photograph the iconic pastel-coloured terraced houses.

activities.name: Notting Hill Film Locations Tour
activities.description: Take a self-guided walk to find famous locations from the film 'Notting Hill', including the blue door and the travel bookshop.

activities.name: Antique Hunting on Portobello Road
activities.description: Explore the world's largest antiques market on a Saturday, browsing for unique treasures and vintage finds. (Cost is estimate for purchase)

activities.name: Royal Albert Hall Guided Tour
activities.description: Take a fascinating tour of this iconic concert hall, see the auditorium, and maybe even hear musicians rehearsing.

activities.name: Attend a Concert or Event
activities.description: Experience a live performance, from classical proms to rock concerts, in this legendary venue. (Cost varies wildly)

activities.name: Visit the Albert Memorial and Serpentine Galleries
activities.description: Admire the ornate Albert Memorial, then visit the two Serpentine Galleries for contemporary art exhibitions.

activities.name: Diana Memorial Playground
activities.description: Let the kids play in this huge, magical playground inspired by Peter Pan, featuring a giant pirate ship.

activities.name: Explore the Design Museum
activities.description: Discover the world of contemporary design, from architecture and fashion to graphics and digital design. (Cost for paid exhibition)

activities.name: See a Play at The Old Vic
activities.description: Experience world-class theatre at this iconic, independent London playhouse. (Cost is an estimate for a mid-range seat)

activities.name: Visit Saatchi Gallery
activities.description: Discover cutting-edge contemporary art by emerging and international artists in a beautiful gallery space. (Some exhibitions may be ticketed)

activities.name: Enjoy a Brick Lane Curry
activities.description: Experience London's famous 'curry mile' by having a meal at one of the many Bangladeshi restaurants.

activities.name: Explore Vintage Shops and Street Art
activities.description: Hunt for vintage clothing bargains and spot vibrant street art and graffiti down the side streets.

activities.name: Street Art Walking Tour
activities.description: Take a self-guided tour of Shoreditch's streets to discover an ever-changing outdoor gallery of work by artists from around the world.

activities.name: Browse Independent Boutiques
activities.description: Explore the unique and trendy independent shops and boutiques that define Shoreditch's creative character.

activities.name: Explore the Barbican Conservatory
activities.description: Visit the hidden tropical oasis on the Barbican's roof, the second biggest conservatory in London. (Open on select days, booking required)

activities.name: Architecture Walk
activities.description: Walk the highwalks and admire the unique and controversial Brutalist architecture of the Barbican Estate.

activities.name: Journey Through London's History
activities.description: Discover the story of the capital from Roman times to the present day, with reconstructed streets and immersive galleries.

activities.name: Winter Ice Skating
activities.description: Go ice skating in one of London's most beautiful settings, the neoclassical courtyard of Somerset House. (Seasonal)

activities.name: Summer Series Concert
activities.description: Attend an open-air concert in the spectacular courtyard during the annual Summer Series. (Seasonal)

activities.name: Visit the Summer Exhibition
activities.description: Visit the world's largest open-submission art show, a fixture of the London summer since 1769.

activities.name: Shop for Liberty Fabrics
activities.description: Explore the iconic Tudor-revival building and browse its world-famous collection of floral and graphic print fabrics. (Cost estimate for 1m fabric)

activities.name: Explore Carnaby Street
activities.description: Walk down the famous pedestrianised street, browse the flagship stores and independent boutiques, and see the unique art installations.

activities.name: Recreate the Abbey Road Album Cover
activities.description: Join fans from around the world to take your photo on the iconic zebra crossing outside the studios. Be careful of traffic!

activities.name: Modern Architecture & Public Art Walk
activities.description: Explore the Canary Wharf estate, admire the modern skyscrapers, and discover over 75 works of public art.

activities.name: Ride the Emirates Air Line Cable Car
activities.description: Take a one-way trip across the River Thames for unique aerial views of the Docklands, The O2, and Greenwich Peninsula.

activities.name: Up at The O2 - Climb the Dome
activities.description: Take an exhilarating guided climb over the roof of The O2 for incredible views of the city. (Ages 8+)

activities.name: Walk to Parliament Hill Viewpoint
activities.description: Enjoy a walk through the wild parkland of Hampstead Heath and climb Parliament Hill for a famous, protected view of the London skyline.

activities.name: Swim in the Hampstead Ponds
activities.description: Take a dip in one of the famous open-air swimming ponds for a bracing and uniquely London experience. (Seasonal, for strong swimmers)

activities.name: Wembley Stadium Tour
activities.description: Go behind the scenes at the home of English football, visit the changing rooms, and walk through the players' tunnel.

activities.name: Twickenham Stadium Tour & World Rugby Museum
activities.description: Visit the home of England Rugby, see the pitch from the Royal Box, and explore the ultimate collection of rugby memorabilia.

activities.name: Wimbledon Lawn Tennis Museum Visit
activities.description: Explore the history of tennis from its origins to the present day and get a peek at the famous Centre Court.

activities.name: Explore the London Transport Museum
activities.description: Climb aboard historic buses and trains, and explore the link between transport and the growth of modern London. Great for families.

activities.name: View of Downing Street
activities.description: Look through the security gates on Whitehall to catch a glimpse of the famous black door of Number 10, the Prime Minister's residence.

activities.name: Pay Respects at The Cenotaph
activities.description: Take a moment to view the United Kingdom's primary national war memorial on the route between Parliament and Trafalgar Square.

activities.name: Watch the Changing of the King's Life Guard
activities.description: See the household cavalry change guard in a daily ceremony that is smaller but just as impressive as the one at Buckingham Palace.

activities.name: Admire The Gherkin from the outside
activities.description: Take a walk around the base of one of London's most recognizable contemporary skyscrapers and appreciate its unique design.

activities.name: Explore Leadenhall Market
activities.description: Wander through the ornate and beautiful covered Victorian market, admiring the architecture and browsing the boutique shops.

activities.name: Find Harry Potter's Diagon Alley Entrance
activities.description: Seek out the blue door in the market that was used as the entrance to the Leaky Cauldron in the first Harry Potter film.

activities.name: Relax in the Sky Garden
activities.description: Enjoy panoramic city views from London's highest public garden. Booking a free ticket in advance is essential.

activities.name: Walk Across the Millennium Bridge
activities.description: Stroll across the pedestrian bridge for fantastic, direct views of St. Paul's Cathedral at one end and Tate Modern at the other.

activities.name: Canal Boat Trip to Camden
activities.description: Take a scenic waterbus ride along Regent's Canal from the picturesque Little Venice to the lively Camden Lock.

activities.name: Waterside Cafe Stop
activities.description: Relax at one of the charming cafes overlooking the canal junction and watch the narrowboats go by.

activities.name: Platform 9Â¾ Photo Op
activities.description: Visit the Harry Potter photo opportunity spot with a luggage trolley disappearing into the wall. Be prepared for long queues.

activities.name: Explore the Wellcome Collection
activities.description: Visit the 'free destination for the incurably curious' and explore fascinating exhibitions on health, life, and our place in the world.

activities.name: See the Treasures of the British Library
activities.description: Visit the Sir John Ritblat Gallery to see world-famous items like the Magna Carta, Shakespeare's First Folio, and original Beatles lyrics.

activities.name: Pre-Theatre Dinner in Soho
activities.description: Soak up the vibrant atmosphere and grab a meal from one of the hundreds of diverse restaurants before a West End show.

activities.name: Explore Soho's Hidden Alleys
activities.description: Wander through the narrow streets and passages of Soho to discover its history, quirky shops, and unique character.

activities.name: Authentic Dim Sum Lunch
activities.description: Explore the bustling streets of Chinatown and enjoy a traditional dim sum meal at one of the many popular restaurants.

activities.name: Browse for Treats at a Chinese Bakery
activities.description: Step into one of the local bakeries and try a delicious and authentic treat like a custard bun or a sweet pastry.

activities.name: Visit The Royal Mews
activities.description: See the spectacular Gold State Coach and other royal carriages in one of the finest working stables in existence.

activities.name: Visit The Queen's Gallery Exhibition
activities.description: View a changing selection of magnificent paintings, drawings, and treasures from the Royal Collection.

activities.name: Explore Apsley House
activities.description: Visit 'Number 1, London', the home of the first Duke of Wellington, and see his stunning collection of art and treasures.

activities.name: Explore all nine decks of HMS Belfast
activities.description: Climb aboard the historic Royal Navy warship and discover what life was like at sea, from the engine rooms to the flag deck.

activities.name: Visit the Painted Hall
activities.description: Marvel at 'Britain's Sistine Chapel', the spectacular baroque Painted Hall at the heart of the Maritime Greenwich UNESCO World Heritage Site.

activities.name: National Maritime Museum Visit
activities.description: Explore Britain's epic relationship with the sea, see Nelson's coat from the Battle of Trafalgar, and let kids run wild in the AHOY! gallery.

activities.name: Ride The Slide at the ArcelorMittal Orbit
activities.description: Take in the views from the top of the UK's tallest sculpture before riding the world's longest and tallest tunnel slide. (Height/age restrictions apply)

activities.name: Explore Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park
activities.description: Walk or cycle through the parklands, see the iconic 2012 Olympic venues, and enjoy the playgrounds and fountains.

activities.name: Swim at the London Aquatics Centre
activities.description: Take a swim in the spectacular Zaha Hadid-designed pool that hosted the 2012 Olympic swimming events.

activities.name: Deer Spotting in Richmond Park
activities.description: Go for a long walk or cycle in London's largest Royal Park and look for the herds of wild red and fallow deer. Keep a respectful distance.

activities.name: Visit Isabella Plantation
activities.description: Explore the stunning 40-acre woodland garden, especially in late spring when the azaleas and rhododendrons are in full bloom.

activities.name: Sunday Morning Flower Market
activities.description: Experience the vibrant sights, sounds, and smells of this bustling flower market. Arrive early to avoid the biggest crowds. (Cost is estimate for purchase)

activities.name: Visit The Garden at 120
activities.description: Enjoy exceptional free views of the surrounding skyscrapers from this public rooftop garden in the heart of the City. No booking required.

activities.name: Visit the Memorial to Heroic Self-Sacrifice
activities.description: Take a quiet moment in this peaceful park to read the moving memorial plaques dedicated to ordinary people who died saving others.

activities.name: Explore Leighton House Museum
activities.description: Visit the opulent former home and studio of Victorian artist Frederic, Lord Leighton, and marvel at its stunning Arab Hall.

activities.name: Visit Chelsea Physic Garden
activities.description: Discover a tranquil, hidden oasis on the edge of the Thames, home to London's oldest botanic garden and around 5,000 medicinal plants.

activities.name: The Courtauld Gallery Visit
activities.description: See a magnificent collection of art, including world-famous Impressionist and Post-Impressionist masterpieces by Manet, Van Gogh, and CÃ©zanne.

activities.name: Explore Southwark Cathedral
activities.description: Visit London's oldest Gothic church, which has links to Shakespeare and Charles Dickens. (Donations encouraged)

activities.name: Attend a Gig at The Roundhouse
activities.description: See a concert at this legendary circular venue in Camden, known for its incredible atmosphere and diverse line-up of artists. (Cost varies)

activities.name: Late Show at Ronnie Scott's
activities.description: Experience the intimate atmosphere of one of the world's most famous jazz clubs for their renowned late late show.

activities.name: Visit The Faraday Museum
activities.description: Explore Michael Faraday's magnetic laboratory and discover 200 years of science history at the Royal Institution. (Open weekdays)

activities.name: Dennis Severs' House 'Still-life Drama' Tour
activities.description: Take a unique, silent tour through an atmospheric time capsule of Spitalfields life, designed to be experienced by your senses. (Booking essential)

activities.name: Highgate Cemetery West Guided Tour
activities.description: Take a guided tour of the atmospheric West Cemetery to see the Egyptian Avenue, Circle of Lebanon, and elaborate Gothic tombs. (Booking essential)

activities.name: Highgate Cemetery East Self-Guided Visit
activities.description: Explore the East Cemetery at your own pace and find the graves of famous residents, including Karl Marx and George Eliot.

activities.name: Walk in Epping Forest
activities.description: Escape the city and enjoy a long walk or cycle through the ancient woodland, following one of the many marked trails.
